companies.detailed_description: Eltel is a leading Northern European provider of technical services for critical infrastructure networks, commonly referred to as 'infranets.' The company specializes in designing, building, maintaining, and upgrading communication and power infrastructure essential to modern society. Eltel operates throughout the Nordics, Poland, and Germany, offering a broad and integrated range of services that span from maintenance and upgrade services to project deliveries.

key_products.name: Power Network Services
key_products.description: Building, maintaining, and upgrading electric power transmission lines and substations. Includes planning, construction, commissioning, and maintenance of high-voltage transmission and distribution networks.

key_products.name: Communication Network Solutions
key_products.description: Services for fixed and mobile telecommunications, including DAS facilities, 5G infrastructure, and Industry 4.0 solutions. Covers homeland security, aviation, rail and road infrastructures.

key_products.name: Maintenance & Repair Services
key_products.description: Comprehensive maintenance and repair services for utilities, cities and communes, industrial customers, and authorities.

recent_news.content: Eltel was listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, marking a significant milestone in the company's growth and market presence.

companies.detailed_description: Vinted is Europe's largest online marketplace for second-hand fashion, operating a peer-to-peer platform that enables users to buy, sell, and exchange pre-owned clothing and accessories. Founded in Vilnius, Lithuania in 2008, Vinted has revolutionized the circular fashion economy by making it easy and attractive for consumers to extend the lifecycle of their clothing. The platform has grown exponentially to serve millions of active users across 16+ markets in Europe and North America, processing hundreds of millions of transactions annually. Vinted's mission centers on making second-hand fashion the first choice worldwide, promoting sustainability while offering consumers affordable access to quality fashion items. The company's innovative approach combines zero listing fees, integrated shipping solutions, buyer protection, and AI-powered recommendations to create a seamless user experience that has disrupted traditional retail and positioned Vinted as a category leader in the rapidly growing recommerce sector.

key_products.description: Advanced tools for professional sellers and boutiques including bulk listing, inventory management, analytics dashboard, and priority support for high-volume sellers.

companies.detailed_description: Fortnox is Sweden's leading cloud-based business software platform, providing comprehensive accounting, invoicing, payroll, and ERP solutions primarily for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Founded in 2001, Fortnox has grown to become the dominant player in the Swedish SME software market, serving over 500,000 customers. The company's platform integrates financial management, HR, e-commerce, and business intelligence tools into a unified ecosystem that simplifies business administration for entrepreneurs and accountants. Fortnox operates on a freemium model where basic accounting software is free, while advanced features and integrations are offered through subscriptions. The company went public on Nasdaq Stockholm in 2015 and has maintained strong growth through both organic expansion and strategic acquisitions. In 2025, EQT Partners acquired Fortnox in a take-private transaction valued at approximately SEK 33 billion, recognizing the company's market leadership, strong recurring revenue model, and significant opportunities for Nordic and European expansion. Fortnox's cloud-native architecture, extensive partner ecosystem of accountants and bookkeepers, and continuous product innovation position it as the category leader in Nordic SME business software.

companies.detailed_description: Flix is Europe's leading intercity mobility provider, operating under the well-known FlixBus and FlixTrain brands. Founded in 2013 by three entrepreneurs in Munich, Flix has revolutionized long-distance travel across Europe and expanded globally to North America, South America, and Asia. The company operates a unique asset-light platform model where it provides technology, marketing, and network optimization while partnering with local bus and train operators who own and operate the vehicles. This innovative approach has enabled rapid scaling to over 400,000 daily connections across 40+ countries, serving 75+ million passengers annually. FlixBus has become synonymous with affordable, comfortable intercity bus travel, offering modern amenities like WiFi, power outlets, and real-time tracking through its mobile app. FlixTrain, launched in Germany, applies the same platform model to rail transport, offering budget-friendly alternatives to traditional train operators. Flix's technology platform handles routing optimization, dynamic pricing, booking management, and customer service, creating significant value through network effects and data-driven operations. The company has achieved profitability and strong unit economics while maintaining affordability for customers and fair economics for partner operators.

companies.detailed_description: TravelPerk is a leading business travel management platform that simplifies corporate travel booking and expense management for companies of all sizes. Founded in 2015 in Barcelona, TravelPerk has grown rapidly to serve over 10,000 companies across 100+ countries, processing billions in travel spend annually. The platform offers an all-in-one solution that combines inventory from multiple sources (flights, hotels, trains, cars) with built-in approval workflows, expense tracking, traveler safety features, and sustainability reporting. TravelPerk's user-friendly interface allows employees to book their own travel while maintaining company policy compliance, significantly reducing administrative burden for travel managers. The company's innovative FlexiPerk feature allows last-minute cancellations for a small fee, providing flexibility that traditional corporate travel arrangements lack. TravelPerk achieved unicorn status in 2021 with a valuation exceeding $1.4 billion and has continued strong growth even through the pandemic, emerging stronger as business travel rebounded. The platform integrates with major expense management systems, HR tools, and accounting software, creating a seamless workflow for modern businesses. With strong unit economics, high customer retention, and significant market opportunity in the fragmented $1.4 trillion business travel market, TravelPerk is positioned as the category leader in modern business travel technology.

companies.detailed_description: Nothing is a consumer electronics company founded in 2020 by Carl Pei, co-founder of OnePlus, with a mission to remove barriers between people and technology. The company has quickly become one of the most exciting and disruptive players in the consumer tech space through its unique design language featuring transparent aesthetics, minimalist approach, and innovative Glyph Interface lighting system. Nothing launched with the Nothing ear (1) wireless earbuds in 2021, which became a viral success and sold over 600,000 units, establishing the brand's reputation for combining distinctive design with competitive pricing. The company then entered the highly competitive smartphone market with the Nothing Phone (1) in 2022 and Phone (2) in 2023, both featuring the signature transparent design and Glyph Interface that uses LEDs for notifications and visual communication. Nothing has successfully carved out a unique position in the market by focusing on design differentiation, building a community-driven brand, and offering products at attractive price points compared to premium competitors. The company has demonstrated strong product-market fit especially with younger consumers who value both aesthetics and functionality. Nothing is building an ecosystem of interconnected products including phones, earbuds, and upcoming accessories, with ambitions to challenge the dominance of Apple and Samsung in the premium smartphone segment.

companies.detailed_description: Wellhub (formerly Gympass) is the world's leading corporate wellness platform, providing employees access to a global network of gyms, fitness studios, personal trainers, wellness apps, and mental health services through a single subscription. Founded in 2012 in Brazil, the company rebranded from Gympass to Wellhub in 2023 to reflect its evolution from gym-focused to comprehensive wellbeing. Wellhub partners with over 15,000 companies globally to offer their 3+ million employees flexible access to 50,000+ fitness and wellness partners across 50+ countries. The platform's innovative business model charges companies a monthly fee per employee (similar to health insurance) while employees get discounted or free access to partnered facilities and services. This B2B2C approach creates value for all stakeholders: companies improve employee health and retention, employees get affordable wellness access, and fitness partners fill unused capacity. Wellhub has achieved strong unit economics by aggregating demand and negotiating favorable rates with suppliers while providing them with incremental revenue and reduced customer acquisition costs. The company grew rapidly during COVID-19 by expanding digital offerings including on-demand fitness classes, meditation apps, therapy sessions, and nutrition coaching. With the increasing focus on employee wellbeing and mental health, Wellhub is positioned at the intersection of HR tech, healthtech, and the $96 billion corporate wellness market.

companies.detailed_description: Zeus is a leading healthcare services and technology company focused on improving patient outcomes and operational efficiency across healthcare systems. The company operates in specialized healthcare segments including medical equipment services, healthcare IT solutions, and clinical workflow optimization. Zeus has built a strong reputation for delivering mission-critical services to hospitals, healthcare systems, and medical facilities, ensuring uptime of essential medical equipment and seamless integration of healthcare technologies. The company's comprehensive service offerings span preventive maintenance, rapid response repairs, IT infrastructure management, and clinical engineering services. Zeus serves thousands of healthcare facilities across multiple regions, providing 24/7 support for life-saving medical equipment including imaging systems, surgical equipment, patient monitoring systems, and diagnostic devices. The company combines technical expertise with healthcare domain knowledge to optimize equipment performance, reduce downtime, extend asset lifecycles, and ensure regulatory compliance. Zeus has grown through both organic expansion and strategic acquisitions, consolidating a fragmented market of regional service providers into a scaled platform with national reach and comprehensive capabilities. The company's technology platform enables predictive maintenance, asset tracking, and performance analytics, helping healthcare providers maximize equipment ROI while ensuring patient safety and care quality.

companies.detailed_description: Dechra Pharmaceuticals is a global specialist veterinary pharmaceuticals and related products business, operating in over 50 countries worldwide. Founded in 1997, Dechra has grown to become one of the world's leading veterinary pharmaceutical companies through a combination of organic growth, strategic acquisitions, and continuous innovation. The company develops, manufactures, markets, and distributes high-quality veterinary medicines and equipment for companion animals (pets) and production animals (livestock). Dechra's portfolio includes pharmaceuticals, vaccines, diagnostics, and equipment addressing critical areas such as anesthesia, dermatology, endocrinology, ophthalmology, and critical care. The company operates with a direct sales force model in key markets while using distributors in smaller markets, ensuring strong relationships with veterinarians and animal health professionals. Dechra invests significantly in R&D to develop both novel therapies and specialty generic products that meet unmet needs in veterinary medicine. In 2024, EQT acquired Dechra in a £4.5 billion take-private transaction, recognizing the company's strong market position, attractive growth fundamentals driven by increased pet ownership and premiumization of pet care, and significant opportunities for international expansion and M&A-driven growth. Dechra is well-positioned to capitalize on structural growth trends in the £33 billion global veterinary pharma market.

companies.detailed_description: ReliaQuest is a leading cybersecurity company providing security operations and threat intelligence solutions that enable organizations to detect, investigate, and respond to cyber threats more effectively. Founded in 2007, ReliaQuest has grown to become a major player in the security operations center (SOC) technology market with its flagship GreyMatter platform. The company serves enterprise clients globally, helping them maximize the value of their existing security investments by integrating disparate security tools into a unified platform with automation and orchestration capabilities. ReliaQuest's unique approach combines technology (GreyMatter platform), threat intelligence, and optional managed services to provide comprehensive security operations support. The GreyMatter platform acts as an open security operations platform that normalizes data from various security tools (SIEM, EDR, firewalls, cloud security, etc.), automates response workflows, and provides analysts with unified visibility across the entire security infrastructure. ReliaQuest's global SOC provides 24/7 monitoring and response services for clients who need additional coverage. With the increasing frequency and sophistication of cyber attacks, demand for ReliaQuest's solutions has surged. The company has achieved strong growth and profitability while maintaining high customer retention rates. In 2025, EQT invested in ReliaQuest recognizing the critical role of security operations in enterprise IT and the company's strong market position.

companies.detailed_description: AMCS is a leading provider of integrated software and vehicle technology solutions for the environmental, waste, and recycling industries. Founded in Ireland in 2003, AMCS has grown to become the dominant global platform serving waste management companies, recyclers, and environmental services providers. The company's comprehensive software suite spans the entire waste management value chain including route optimization, fleet management, customer billing, operations management, compliance reporting, and business intelligence. AMCS serves over 3,800 customers across 25+ countries, managing millions of service points and optimizing thousands of vehicles daily. The platform's route optimization algorithms save customers millions in fuel costs and reduce carbon emissions while improving service levels. AMCS combines deep domain expertise in waste management with advanced technology including AI, telematics, computer vision, and IoT sensors to drive operational efficiency. The company has executed a successful buy-and-build strategy, acquiring complementary technologies and expanding geographically. AMCS's Vision AI uses computer vision to automate waste container monitoring and contamination detection. The company's solutions are mission-critical for customers, resulting in high retention rates and predictable recurring revenue. With increasing focus on sustainability, circular economy, and ESG compliance, AMCS is positioned to benefit from secular trends driving digital transformation in the environmental services industry.

companies.detailed_description: SHL Medical is a world-leading solution provider in the design, development, and manufacturing of advanced drug delivery systems including autoinjectors, pen injectors, and wearable injectors for self-administration of injectable drugs. Founded in 1989, SHL Medical partners with pharmaceutical and biotech companies globally to bring innovative therapies to patients through user-friendly, reliable delivery devices. The company's vertically integrated model spans the entire product lifecycle from design and engineering through manufacturing, assembly, and lifecycle management. SHL Medical operates state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Switzerland, Sweden, Taiwan, and the United States, producing hundreds of millions of devices annually. The company's capabilities include human factors engineering, regulatory support, supply chain management, and connected device technology. SHL Medical's devices are used to deliver a wide range of biologic therapies including treatments for diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis, and other chronic conditions requiring regular injections. The shift from hospital-administered to patient self-administered biologics creates strong tailwinds for SHL Medical's business. The company invests heavily in R&D to develop next-generation connected devices with adherence monitoring, dose tracking, and connectivity to digital health platforms. SHL Medical serves major pharmaceutical companies including Novo Nordisk, Sanofi, and other leading biopharma firms. In 2023, EQT acquired SHL Medical recognizing the company's critical role in the biologics value chain and attractive growth fundamentals driven by the biologics megatrend.

companies.detailed_description: Wayflyer is a fast-growing fintech company providing revenue-based financing and growth solutions for e-commerce businesses globally. Founded in 2019 in Dublin, Wayflyer has revolutionized how online merchants access capital by offering flexible funding based on actual revenue performance rather than traditional credit metrics. The company uses data from e-commerce platforms (Shopify, Amazon, WooCommerce, etc.) to underwrite loans within 24 hours, providing working capital advances of $10K-$20M to fund inventory, marketing, and growth initiatives. Wayflyer's proprietary underwriting algorithms analyze millions of data points including sales trends, customer behavior, marketing performance, and inventory turnover to assess creditworthiness and set personalized terms. Repayments are automatically deducted as a percentage of daily sales, aligning with business cash flows. This approach has made Wayflyer extremely popular with e-commerce merchants who struggle to access traditional bank financing. Since launch, Wayflyer has deployed over $3 billion in funding to 1,000+ e-commerce companies across 10+ countries. The company has expanded beyond financing to offer marketing and growth tools, creating an integrated platform for e-commerce success. Wayflyer achieved unicorn status in 2022 and has maintained strong growth despite challenging fintech market conditions. The company's data-driven approach, fast decisioning, and flexible terms have created a compelling alternative to traditional financing for the $5+ trillion e-commerce market.

companies.detailed_description: Cerba HealthCare is a leading European clinical laboratory and diagnostic testing company providing comprehensive medical testing services to physicians, hospitals, and patients across Europe. Founded in 1967, Cerba has grown to become one of Europe's largest independent laboratory networks, performing over 350 million tests annually across 600+ laboratories and patient service centers. The company offers a full spectrum of diagnostic services including routine blood tests, specialized molecular diagnostics, pathology, genetics, and advanced testing for complex conditions. Cerba's core business model involves collecting samples from physicians' offices, hospitals, and walk-in centers, processing them in centralized high-throughput laboratories with automation and specialized testing capabilities, and delivering results electronically within 24-48 hours. The company has invested heavily in automation, IT systems, and advanced diagnostics including genomics, proteomics, and liquid biopsy for cancer detection. Cerba provides both routine and esoteric testing, with strong capabilities in specialized areas like oncology, women's health, infectious diseases, and rare disorders. The company operates across France, Belgium, Switzerland, and is expanding to additional European markets. Cerba has achieved scale advantages through centralized testing, route optimization for sample logistics, and IT investments. In 2022, EQT partnered with Cerba recognizing the company's market leadership and opportunities for further consolidation in the fragmented European diagnostics market.

companies.detailed_description: 3Shape is a global leader in dental and hearing aid scanning solutions and CAD/CAM (Computer-Aided Design/Computer-Aided Manufacturing) software for the orthodontic and audiological industries. Founded in 2000 in Denmark by three engineers, 3Shape has revolutionized dental workflows by digitizing impressions and prosthetic design processes. The company's intraoral scanners capture highly accurate 3D images of patients' teeth, replacing traditional physical impressions with digital workflows that are faster, more accurate, and more comfortable for patients. 3Shape's software enables dental laboratories and clinics to design crowns, bridges, implants, and orthodontic appliances digitally, which are then manufactured using 3D printing or milling. The company serves over 36,000 clinics and labs worldwide, with scanners installed in practices across 150+ countries. 3Shape has expanded from dental to include hearing aid scanning solutions, leveraging similar 3D scanning technology. The company invests heavily in R&D (25%+ of revenue) to maintain technology leadership, with constant innovation in scanning accuracy, speed, software capabilities, and AI-powered features. 3Shape competes with Align Technology (Invisalign), Dentsply Sirona, and other dental equipment companies. In 2022, EQT acquired 3Shape at a €3+ billion valuation, recognizing the company's market leadership and opportunities in the digitalization of dentistry megatrend.

companies.detailed_description: Ardoq is a leading enterprise architecture and data-driven transformation platform that helps organizations visualize, plan, and execute digital transformation initiatives. Founded in 2013 in Oslo, Ardoq provides software that automatically discovers, maps, and analyzes an organization's technology landscape, applications, data flows, business processes, and organizational structures. The platform enables IT leaders, enterprise architects, and business strategists to make informed decisions about technology investments, application rationalization, cloud migration, M&A integration, and digital transformation projects. Ardoq's unique approach combines automated data collection from various sources (CMDBs, APM tools, cloud providers) with collaborative modeling capabilities and powerful analytics to create a dynamic, always-current view of the enterprise architecture. The platform uses graph database technology and AI to identify dependencies, risks, redundancies, and optimization opportunities across complex IT environments. Ardoq serves hundreds of global enterprises including major banks, insurance companies, and large corporations undergoing transformation. The company has achieved strong product-market fit as organizations increasingly need visibility and control over their growing technology complexity. Ardoq's SaaS model provides recurring revenue with strong net retention as customers expand usage across more departments and use cases. In 2022, EQT Growth invested in Ardoq recognizing the massive market opportunity in enterprise architecture and transformation management software.

companies.detailed_description: Avetta is the leading provider of supply chain risk management and supplier compliance solutions, helping organizations qualify, onboard, and monitor contractors and suppliers to ensure workplace safety, regulatory compliance, and operational standards. Founded in 2003 (originally as PICS Auditing), Avetta has built the world's largest supplier compliance network serving over 125,000 suppliers and 500+ client companies globally. The platform provides comprehensive supplier qualification including safety prequalification, insurance verification, background checks, and ongoing compliance monitoring. Avetta's cloud-based software aggregates and verifies supplier credentials, certifications, safety records, and compliance documentation, enabling clients to manage supplier risk across their extended workforce. The company serves industries with high safety and compliance requirements including oil & gas, utilities, manufacturing, construction, mining, and transportation. Avetta's value proposition addresses critical business needs: reducing workplace incidents, ensuring regulatory compliance, streamlining supplier onboarding, and mitigating supply chain risks. The network effect creates value where each supplier's credentials can be reused across multiple clients, while clients gain access to pre-qualified suppliers. Avetta has executed a successful acquisition strategy, integrating complementary technologies including analytics, e-learning, and supplier management tools. The platform is mission-critical for customers managing thousands of contractors, with high retention rates and expansion within accounts. In 2024, EQT invested in Avetta recognizing the company's market leadership and strong growth fundamentals.

companies.detailed_description: Advanced MedAesthetic Partners (AMAP) is a rapidly growing platform of medical aesthetics and dermatology practices across the United States. The company partners with physician-owned aesthetic practices to provide operational support, growth capital, and best-practice sharing while maintaining clinical autonomy for physicians. AMAP focuses on non-invasive aesthetic procedures including Botox, dermal fillers, laser treatments, body contouring, skin rejuvenation, and medical-grade skincare. The company serves the booming medical aesthetics market, which has grown significantly driven by increasing consumer acceptance, social media influence, technological advancements, and demographic trends. AMAP's platform model provides affiliated practices with purchasing power, marketing support, technology infrastructure, administrative services, and access to capital for equipment and expansion. Partner physicians maintain control over clinical decisions and patient care while benefiting from the platform's operational excellence. The company has executed an aggressive buy-and-build strategy, acquiring premier aesthetic practices in attractive markets and implementing operational improvements to drive revenue growth and margin expansion. AMAP's practices offer a comprehensive menu of aesthetic services performed by experienced physicians and staff in upscale, spa-like environments. The recurring nature of aesthetic treatments (Botox every 3-4 months, fillers 6-12 months) creates predictable revenue streams. In 2022, EQT invested in AMAP recognizing the attractive secular growth dynamics in medical aesthetics and the platform's potential to consolidate a highly fragmented market.

companies.detailed_description: Envirotainer is the global leader in secure cold chain solutions for pharmaceutical and life science shipments, specializing in active temperature-controlled air cargo containers that protect sensitive medications and biologics during transportation. Founded in 1985, Envirotainer has pioneered the development of air cargo containers with active cooling systems (compressor-based) that maintain precise temperatures for time- and temperature-sensitive pharmaceuticals being shipped globally. The company's containers protect billions of dollars worth of critical medications including vaccines, biologics, gene therapies, and other temperature-sensitive drugs that would be destroyed if exposed to temperature excursions. Envirotainer operates a leasing and services model where pharmaceutical companies lease containers for specific shipments, with Envirotainer providing maintenance, quality assurance, tracking, and global logistics support through its network of service centers at major airports worldwide. The company's RKN and RAP container models can maintain 2-8°C or other required temperatures for up to 200+ hours, with real-time monitoring and data logging to ensure compliance with pharmaceutical regulations. Envirotainer serves all major pharmaceutical and biotech companies, playing a mission-critical role in the global distribution of medications. The growth of biologics, vaccines, and gene therapies (which require strict cold chain) has driven strong demand for Envirotainer's solutions. The company operates a global network with presence at 100+ airports and has a fleet of thousands of containers. In 2022, EQT acquired Envirotainer recognizing the company's market leadership and favorable tailwinds from biologics growth.

companies.detailed_description: Hantverksdata is a leading Nordic provider of cloud-based business management software specifically designed for craftsmen, contractors, and trade businesses in the construction and home services sectors. The company offers comprehensive ERP solutions that help electricians, plumbers, HVAC technicians, carpenters, and other trades manage their entire business operations including project management, scheduling, invoicing, time tracking, material procurement, customer management, and accounting. Founded in Sweden, Hantverksdata has become the dominant software provider for the Nordic trades sector, serving tens of thousands of craftsmen and small contracting businesses. The company's software is specifically tailored to the unique needs of trades businesses with features like job costing, subcontractor management, mobile apps for field workers, quote generation, and integration with accounting systems. Hantverksdata's solutions help craftsmen run more professional businesses, improve productivity, ensure timely invoicing and payment collection, and comply with regulatory requirements. The company has established a strong brand in the Nordic construction and trades market through word-of-mouth and partnerships with trade associations. Hantverksdata operates on a SaaS subscription model with high customer retention as the software becomes embedded in daily business operations. The company has opportunities for geographic expansion, vertical market extensions, and product enhancements. In 2024, EQT invested in Hantverksdata recognizing the company's market leadership in an underpenetrated sector with significant digitalization opportunity.

companies.detailed_description: Harvey is a cutting-edge generative AI platform specifically built for legal professionals and law firms, providing AI-powered assistance for legal research, document drafting, contract analysis, due diligence, and other complex legal tasks. Founded in 2022 by Winston Weinberg (former Dreadwood engineer) and Gabriel Pereyra (former DeepMind researcher), Harvey has quickly become one of the most high-profile AI applications in the legal industry. The platform is built on large language models (LLMs) fine-tuned specifically for legal work, trained on vast corpora of case law, statutes, regulations, and legal documents. Harvey can assist lawyers with tasks like legal research across multiple jurisdictions, contract review and redlining, memorandum drafting, regulatory analysis, and due diligence document review. The platform understands legal concepts, precedents, and reasoning, providing substantive assistance beyond simple text generation. Harvey is used by multiple top-tier law firms including Allen & Overy, Freshfields, and other major firms, processing thousands of legal queries daily. The platform integrates into lawyers' workflows through chat interfaces and integrations with legal practice management systems. Harvey represents a significant productivity enhancement for legal professionals, handling routine research and drafting while lawyers focus on high-value strategic counsel. The company has raised substantial funding at a multi-billion dollar valuation despite being less than 3 years old, reflecting investor enthusiasm for AI transforming professional services. In 2025, EQT Ventures invested in Harvey recognizing the massive market opportunity in legal AI and the company's technology leadership.

companies.detailed_description: 1X (formerly Halodi Robotics) is a pioneering humanoid robotics company developing safe, intelligent androids designed to work alongside humans in real-world environments. Founded in Norway in 2014, 1X's mission is to create abundant labor capacity through android systems that can perform useful physical work in homes, workplaces, and society. The company's flagship products include EVE, a wheeled android designed for industrial and commercial applications, and NEO, a bipedal humanoid robot for consumer and home applications. 1X takes a unique approach focused on safety-first design, using actuators with safe force limitations and compliant materials that enable robots to work safely near humans without cages or barriers. The company's technology combines advanced robotics hardware, computer vision, machine learning for task execution, and increasingly sophisticated AI for decision-making and learning. 1X is training its robots using both simulated environments and real-world deployments, with EVE units already operating in security patrol and logistics roles. The company has attracted significant attention and investment from the AI and robotics community, with backing from OpenAI among others. 1X represents a bet on the coming era of embodied AI where large language models and AI systems are integrated into physical robots capable of performing complex real-world tasks. The total addressable market encompasses labor in numerous industries where robots could augment or replace human workers in repetitive, dangerous, or physically demanding roles. In 2024, EQT Ventures invested in 1X recognizing the company's technical leadership and the massive long-term opportunity in humanoid robotics.

companies.detailed_description: evroc is an innovative European cloud infrastructure company building a sovereign, sustainable hyperscale cloud platform specifically designed for European businesses and public sector organizations. Founded in 2023, evroc aims to provide a European alternative to US-based cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) with data residency, regulatory compliance, and European values at its core. The company is deploying cutting-edge data centers powered by renewable energy across strategic European locations, offering Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) and Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) capabilities competitive with global cloud giants. evroc's value proposition addresses growing European concerns about data sovereignty, GDPR compliance, dependence on US cloud providers, and sustainability. The company leverages latest-generation hardware, advanced cooling technologies, and green energy to deliver high-performance computing with minimal environmental impact. evroc targets enterprises, governments, and organizations requiring data to remain within European jurisdiction for regulatory, security, or strategic reasons. The company's go-to-market strategy focuses on industries with strict data requirements including government, healthcare, financial services, and critical infrastructure. evroc has assembled an experienced team with backgrounds from hyperscale cloud providers, data center operations, and enterprise sales. The company is venture-backed and pursuing rapid infrastructure deployment to capture share in the growing European cloud market, which continues to experience strong growth driven by digital transformation initiatives.

companies.detailed_description: Parloa is a leading conversational AI platform enabling enterprises to automate customer service through intelligent voice and chat agents powered by advanced natural language processing and large language models. Founded in 2018 in Berlin, Parloa provides software that allows companies to build, deploy, and manage AI-powered customer service agents that can understand customer intent, resolve queries, process transactions, and escalate complex issues to human agents when needed. The platform uses state-of-the-art NLP and generative AI to create conversations that feel natural and human-like, dramatically improving upon traditional IVR (interactive voice response) systems and rigid chatbots. Parloa's customers include major European enterprises in telecommunications, utilities, financial services, and e-commerce who handle millions of customer interactions monthly. The platform can integrate with existing contact center infrastructure, CRM systems, and backend systems to provide contextual, personalized customer service at scale. Parloa's technology can automate 60-80% of routine customer service interactions, reducing wait times, improving customer satisfaction, and significantly lowering operational costs. The company supports multiple languages and channels (voice, chat, messaging apps) through a unified platform. Parloa has achieved strong product-market fit with enterprise customers and is expanding across Europe and into North America. In 2023, EQT Ventures invested in Parloa recognizing the massive market opportunity as generative AI revolutionizes customer service automation.

companies.detailed_description: Payrails is a next-generation payment infrastructure platform that enables businesses to orchestrate and optimize payments across multiple payment service providers (PSPs), payment methods, and geographies through a single unified API. Founded in 2021 in Berlin, Payrails addresses a critical challenge for high-growth e-commerce, marketplaces, and digital platforms: managing complex payment operations across multiple providers while optimizing for cost, approval rates, and user experience. The company's payment orchestration platform provides intelligent routing, smart retries, tokenization, reconciliation, and unified reporting across all payment providers. Payrails allows businesses to easily add or switch payment providers without code changes, A/B test different providers, route transactions based on rules (cost, geography, payment method), and failover to backup providers if primary provider is down. This flexibility and control is particularly valuable for global businesses processing millions of transactions. Payrails also provides advanced features like network tokenization, fraud prevention, PCI compliance simplification, and detailed analytics. The platform serves fast-growing e-commerce companies, marketplaces, and SaaS businesses that have outgrown simple payment solutions and need enterprise-grade orchestration. Payrails competes with older orchestration platforms and aims to be the modern, developer-friendly solution. In 2023, EQT Ventures invested in Payrails recognizing the growing need for payment infrastructure in an increasingly complex payment landscape.

companies.detailed_description: Sifflet is a data observability and data quality platform that helps data teams monitor, troubleshoot, and ensure the reliability of data pipelines and analytics infrastructure. Founded in 2021, Sifflet addresses the critical challenge that data-driven companies face: ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and freshness as data environments grow increasingly complex. The platform automatically monitors data warehouses, data lakes, and data pipelines for anomalies, data quality issues, schema changes, and performance problems, alerting data teams before issues impact business decisions or customer-facing applications. Sifflet provides comprehensive data lineage visualization showing how data flows through systems, impact analysis when changes occur, and root cause analysis when data issues arise. The platform integrates with major data platforms including Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery, dbt, and other modern data stack tools. Sifflet serves data engineers, analytics engineers, and data analysts at data-driven companies across e-commerce, fintech, SaaS, and other industries where data quality directly impacts business operations. The company's value proposition addresses the reality that data quality issues cost companies millions through bad decisions, customer experience problems, and operational inefficiencies. Sifflet has achieved strong product-market fit in the growing data observability category, competing with companies like Monte Carlo Data and Datadog. In 2023, EQT Ventures invested in Sifflet recognizing the company's technical excellence and the massive market opportunity as companies invest heavily in data infrastructure.

companies.detailed_description: Talentium is an AI-powered talent intelligence and workforce planning platform that helps enterprises optimize their workforce strategy, talent acquisition, and internal mobility. The company uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to analyze workforce data, skills inventories, performance metrics, and market intelligence to provide actionable insights for HR leaders and executives. Talentium's platform helps organizations identify skills gaps, predict attrition risks, optimize hiring strategies, match internal candidates to opportunities, and plan workforce transformations. The software integrates data from HRIS systems, applicant tracking systems, performance management tools, and external labor market data to create a comprehensive view of organizational talent. Talentium's AI can recommend upskilling pathways, identify high-potential employees, forecast hiring needs based on business plans, and suggest internal mobility opportunities before external hiring. The platform is particularly valuable for large enterprises undergoing digital transformation who need to reskill existing workforce and make strategic talent decisions. Talentium competes in the growing HR tech and workforce analytics market where companies are increasingly using AI and data to optimize their most important asset: human capital. The company serves Fortune 500 companies and large European enterprises. In 2024, EQT Ventures invested in Talentium recognizing the strategic importance of talent intelligence in the age of AI and skills transformation.

companies.detailed_description: The Exploration Company is a pioneering European space startup developing reusable orbital vehicles and cargo transportation systems for missions to low Earth orbit, lunar orbit, and beyond. Founded in 2021, the company aims to establish Europe's first competitive cargo return capability, currently dominated by SpaceX in the West and Chinese companies in the East. The Exploration Company is building Nyx, a modular and reusable space vehicle designed to transport cargo to and from space stations, deploy satellites, and eventually support lunar missions. The company's approach combines European engineering excellence with modern commercial space practices, focusing on reusability, modularity, and cost efficiency. Nyx is designed to launch on multiple rockets including Ariane 6, Falcon 9, and other commercial launchers, providing flexibility and redundancy. The vehicle will enable cargo delivery to the International Space Station (ISS), future commercial space stations, and lunar Gateway. The Exploration Company has secured contracts from European Space Agency (ESA) and commercial customers for cargo missions starting in 2026-2027. The company represents Europe's ambition to maintain independent access to space and participate in the growing commercial space economy including ISS logistics, lunar exploration, in-space manufacturing, and satellite deployment. With geopolitical tensions highlighting the strategic importance of space access, The Exploration Company is positioned to capture European and international demand for space transportation services. In 2023, EQT Ventures invested recognizing the company's technical capabilities and the strategic opportunity in commercial space.

companies.detailed_description: Marvel Fusion is a deep-tech company pioneering laser-driven inertial fusion energy as a potential solution for clean, abundant baseload power. Founded in 2019 by a team of fusion physicists and engineers, Marvel Fusion is developing an innovative approach to fusion energy using ultra-powerful lasers to create fusion reactions without radioactive fuel or long-lived nuclear waste. The company's technology aims to overcome challenges that have prevented fusion from becoming commercially viable for decades. Marvel Fusion's approach uses nanostructured fuel targets and precise laser pulses to achieve fusion conditions, with the goal of achieving net energy gain and eventually building commercial power plants. The company has assembled a world-class team of fusion scientists, laser physicists, and engineers from leading research institutions. Marvel Fusion has secured partnerships with research facilities including Colorado State University for laser technology development. The company is pursuing an ambitious roadmap from laboratory demonstrations to pilot plants to commercial power generation. Fusion energy represents the ultimate clean energy source - abundant fuel from seawater, no carbon emissions, no long-lived radioactive waste, and continuous baseload power unlike intermittent renewables. If successful, fusion could transform global energy systems. Marvel Fusion is part of a new generation of private fusion companies (alongside Commonwealth Fusion, TAE, Helion) attracting billions in investment. In 2025, EQT Ventures invested in Marvel Fusion recognizing the massive potential impact if fusion becomes commercially viable.

companies.detailed_description: IntegrityNext is a leading supply chain sustainability and ESG compliance platform that enables companies to assess, monitor, and improve environmental, social, and governance (ESG) performance across their supplier networks. Founded in 2018 in Munich, IntegrityNext provides software that automates the collection and analysis of supplier ESG data, helping procurement teams identify risks, ensure compliance with regulations, and drive sustainability improvements throughout the supply chain. The platform addresses the growing requirement for companies to report on Scope 3 emissions (supply chain) and demonstrate responsible sourcing practices. IntegrityNext's solution allows companies to send ESG questionnaires to suppliers, automatically verify responses against third-party data sources, assess risk levels, track improvement actions, and generate compliance reports for regulations like the German Supply Chain Act and EU Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive. The platform covers environmental topics (carbon emissions, waste, water), social issues (labor conditions, human rights, diversity), and governance (corruption, business ethics). IntegrityNext serves hundreds of enterprises across manufacturing, automotive, retail, and other industries with complex global supply chains. The company's network includes tens of thousands of suppliers who complete assessments through the platform. As ESG regulations tighten globally and stakeholders demand supply chain transparency, IntegrityNext is positioned at the center of the sustainability compliance market. In 2023, EQT Ventures invested in IntegrityNext recognizing the massive market opportunity driven by regulatory tailwinds and corporate sustainability commitments.

companies.detailed_description: GotPhoto is a leading SaaS platform for professional photographers specializing in volume photography including school pictures, sports teams, events, and group photography. Founded in Norway, GotPhoto provides an end-to-end solution that helps photographers manage their entire workflow from scheduling shoots, capturing images, automated photo organization using AI face recognition, online galleries for customer viewing, order processing, payment collection, and product fulfillment. The platform's killer feature is AI-powered face recognition that automatically matches individual photos to the correct students, athletes, or event participants, dramatically reducing manual sorting time. This automation enables photographers to handle much larger volumes and serve more schools and organizations profitably. GotPhoto serves thousands of professional photographers across schools, sports organizations, dance studios, and event photography businesses. The company's business model includes SaaS subscriptions for photographers plus revenue sharing on print and product sales through integrated e-commerce. GotPhoto handles the logistics of print production and delivery through partnerships with photo labs, providing turnkey solution for photographers. The platform has strong retention as it becomes central to photographers' business operations and customer relationships. GotPhoto is expanding internationally and adding new photography verticals. In 2023, EQT Ventures invested recognizing the company's strong product-market fit and opportunity to modernize the fragmented volume photography industry through technology.

companies.detailed_description: DELTA Fiber is the Netherlands' third-largest telecommunications operator, providing fiber-optic internet, television, and telephony services to residential and business customers across the Netherlands. The company operates an extensive fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) network covering millions of homes and businesses, delivering ultra-fast broadband speeds up to 10 Gbps. DELTA Fiber was formed through the combination of multiple regional fiber networks and cable operators, creating a national alternative to incumbents KPN and VodafoneZiggo. The company has invested billions in deploying fiber infrastructure, particularly in smaller cities and rural areas underserved by major operators. DELTA Fiber's network provides critical digital infrastructure enabling remote work, streaming, gaming, smart homes, and business connectivity. The company offers competitive packages with symmetric upload/download speeds, no data caps, and strong customer service. DELTA Fiber serves both consumer mass market and business/enterprise segments including SMEs and larger organizations requiring dedicated fiber connections. The company's infrastructure asset generates recurring subscription revenue with defensive characteristics and attractive cash flow. As the Netherlands continues its national fiber rollout and consumers demand faster speeds, DELTA Fiber is positioned to gain market share. In 2022, EQT Infrastructure acquired DELTA Fiber recognizing the strategic value of fiber infrastructure and opportunities for consolidation, network expansion, and operational improvements.

companies.detailed_description: Icon Group is a leading Nordic social care provider operating residential care homes, day care centers, and support services for children, youth, and adults with special needs, disabilities, and complex care requirements. The company provides individualized care and support services helping vulnerable populations achieve greater independence, development, and quality of life. Icon Group operates dozens of facilities across Denmark providing 24/7 residential care, therapeutic interventions, education support, and life skills training. The company serves diverse client groups including children with behavioral challenges, youth at risk, adults with developmental disabilities, and individuals with mental health needs. Icon Group's approach emphasizes person-centered care, evidence-based interventions, and skilled professional staff including social workers, therapists, educators, and care specialists. The company works closely with Danish municipalities who fund and refer clients to Icon Group's services. Social care in Denmark is primarily publicly funded through local government budgets, providing stable and predictable revenue streams. Icon Group has grown through both organic expansion of existing facilities and strategic acquisitions of smaller regional providers, consolidating a fragmented market. The company invests in staff training, quality improvement, and specialized programs to deliver superior outcomes for clients. The social care sector benefits from defensive characteristics with consistent demand, public funding, and demographic tailwinds. In 2022, EQT invested in Icon Group recognizing the company's market leadership and opportunities for continued consolidation and quality improvements.

companies.detailed_description: InstaVolt is a leading UK operator of rapid electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure, providing high-power charging stations across the United Kingdom to accelerate the transition to electric mobility. Founded in 2016, InstaVolt operates a network of over 1,500 rapid and ultra-rapid charging points at locations including retail parks, service stations, supermarkets, and public car parks. The company focuses on 50kW-150kW+ rapid chargers that can charge most EVs to 80% in 20-45 minutes, addressing the critical need for convenient public charging infrastructure. InstaVolt's chargers are strategically located along major routes and at high-traffic retail destinations, ensuring EV drivers can charge while shopping or during travel. The company differentiates through reliability, user-friendly contactless payment, transparent pricing, and high uptime rates. InstaVolt does not require membership or apps - drivers simply tap their credit/debit card to start charging. The company partners with site hosts (retailers, property owners) to install and operate charging infrastructure, sharing revenue from charging fees. InstaVolt is benefiting from massive tailwinds including UK government targets to phase out new petrol/diesel car sales by 2030, rapidly increasing EV adoption, and large infrastructure investment needs to support the EV transition. The company is scaling its network aggressively and improving charger technology. In 2022, EQT Infrastructure invested in InstaVolt recognizing the strategic importance of EV charging infrastructure and the significant growth opportunity.

companies.detailed_description: Levande is a leading Swedish social care provider operating residential care homes and support services for individuals with disabilities, mental health challenges, and complex care needs. The company provides person-centered care and support services enabling clients to live meaningful, independent lives in community-based settings. Levande operates numerous group homes, supported living arrangements, and day programs across Sweden, serving hundreds of clients with varying levels of support requirements. The company employs skilled care professionals including social workers, support workers, therapists, and specialized staff trained to work with individuals with autism, intellectual disabilities, neuropsychiatric conditions, and mental health challenges. Levande's philosophy emphasizes dignity, choice, and inclusion, tailoring support plans to each individual's goals and needs. Services range from 24/7 residential care in specialized facilities to supported independent living with visiting support workers. Levande works closely with Swedish municipalities who are responsible for providing social services and who fund placements through per-diem rates. The company has grown through both organic expansion and acquisitions of smaller regional care providers, consolidating Sweden's fragmented social care market. Levande invests in staff training, quality frameworks, and evidence-based practices to deliver excellent outcomes. The social care sector in Sweden benefits from strong public funding, aging demographics increasing demand, and shift toward community-based care models. In 2022, EQT invested in Levande recognizing the company's quality reputation and opportunities for continued growth through market consolidation.

companies.detailed_description: Seven Seas Water Group is a leading provider of water treatment and desalination solutions serving municipalities, industrial clients, and remote communities globally. The company designs, builds, finances, operates, and maintains water treatment facilities including desalination plants, wastewater treatment systems, and industrial water recycling facilities. Seven Seas Water Group specializes in challenging water scarcity environments and remote locations where conventional water infrastructure is unavailable or inadequate. The company provides turnkey solutions from project development through long-term operations under Build-Own-Operate-Transfer (BOOT) and Design-Build-Operate (DBO) models. Seven Seas Water Group serves clients across the Caribbean, Africa, Middle East, and other water-stressed regions where reliable water supply is critical. The company's facilities provide essential services to millions of people, ranging from small island communities to major industrial operations. Seven Seas Water Group employs advanced treatment technologies including reverse osmosis, membrane bioreactors, and water recycling systems, with increasing focus on energy efficiency and sustainability. The company's long-term operation contracts (typically 15-25 years) generate stable, inflation-linked cash flows backed by government or investment-grade offtakers. Seven Seas Water Group operates over 100 facilities globally treating hundreds of millions of gallons daily. The company is positioned to benefit from increasing water scarcity, population growth, industrialization, and climate change impacts on water resources. In 2025, EQT Infrastructure invested in Seven Seas Water Group recognizing the essential nature of water infrastructure and attractive infrastructure asset characteristics.

companies.detailed_description: Trescal is the world's largest independent provider of calibration services and laboratory instrument services, ensuring that measuring and testing equipment used across industries maintains accuracy and regulatory compliance. Founded in France in 2007, Trescal operates over 120 laboratories across 20+ countries, calibrating millions of instruments annually for clients in pharmaceuticals, aerospace, automotive, electronics, energy, and other precision-critical industries. Calibration services are essential for companies to ensure their measuring instruments (scales, thermometers, pressure gauges, oscilloscopes, etc.) provide accurate readings, which is critical for product quality, safety, and regulatory compliance. Trescal's technicians perform on-site and in-laboratory calibration using certified reference standards traceable to national metrology institutes. The company's accreditations include ISO17025 and industry-specific certifications required by regulated customers. Trescal serves thousands of clients globally from small manufacturers to multinational corporations, providing recurring calibration services on annual or multi-year contracts. The company has grown through aggressive M&A, acquiring over 100 smaller calibration companies globally and integrating them into a unified platform with standardized processes, IT systems, and best practices. Trescal's scale enables investments in advanced calibration capabilities, specialized equipment, and training that smaller competitors cannot match. The business is highly recurring with strong retention as regulatory requirements mandate regular recalibration. In 2023, EQT invested in Trescal recognizing the company's market leadership and opportunities for continued consolidation of the fragmented global calibration services market.

companies.detailed_description: CFC is a global specialty insurance provider focusing on cyber insurance and emerging risks for businesses. Founded in 2000, CFC has become one of the world's leading cyber insurance carriers, providing policies that protect companies against cyber attacks, data breaches, ransomware, and technology failures. The company underwrites cyber insurance for small and medium-sized businesses through to large enterprises, covering costs including incident response, business interruption, data recovery, legal expenses, regulatory fines, and customer notification. CFC has developed deep expertise in cyber risk assessment, using proprietary data and analytics to underwrite policies effectively. The company also provides technology insurance, professional liability, media liability, and other specialty lines. CFC operates globally with offices in London, New York, Austin, Brussels, and Hong Kong, serving clients across multiple industries. The cyber insurance market has grown exponentially as cyber threats increase in frequency and severity, with ransomware attacks costing businesses billions annually. CFC combines insurance underwriting with risk management services, providing customers with tools and guidance to improve their security posture. The company has maintained disciplined underwriting through challenging market conditions and cyber catastrophe events. CFC is backed by reinsurance capacity from major global reinsurers. In 2022, EQT invested in CFC recognizing the company's market leadership in the fast-growing cyber insurance sector and the critical importance of cyber risk transfer as digital threats proliferate.

companies.detailed_description: CluePoints is a leading provider of central statistical monitoring (CSM) and risk-based monitoring (RBM) solutions for clinical trials, helping pharmaceutical and biotech companies improve data quality, reduce risks, and ensure regulatory compliance during drug development. Founded in 2005 in Belgium, CluePoints pioneered the application of advanced statistics and machine learning to detect data quality issues, protocol deviations, and potential fraud in clinical trial data. The company's software platform analyzes data from clinical trials in real-time, using sophisticated algorithms to identify anomalies, outliers, and patterns that may indicate data integrity problems at investigator sites. This allows sponsors to focus monitoring resources on high-risk sites and issues rather than routine source data verification at all sites. CluePoints' approach aligns with regulatory guidance from FDA and EMA encouraging risk-based monitoring to make clinical trials more efficient while maintaining data quality. The platform integrates with electronic data capture (EDC) systems and clinical trial management systems, providing centralized oversight across global multi-site trials. CluePoints serves top pharmaceutical companies, CROs (contract research organizations), and biotech firms running complex clinical trials. The company's solutions are used in thousands of clinical trials including pivotal studies for drug approvals. CluePoints helps customers reduce monitoring costs by 30-50% while improving data quality and reducing timeline risks. In 2024, EQT Life Sciences invested in CluePoints recognizing the company's market leadership and the growing adoption of risk-based monitoring in clinical trials.

companies.detailed_description: OEM International is a leading European provider of facility services and workplace solutions including cleaning, property services, technical maintenance, and integrated facility management (IFM) for commercial, industrial, and public sector clients. The company delivers essential services that keep workplaces clean, safe, functional, and well-maintained. OEM International serves thousands of clients across Nordic countries and select European markets, providing daily cleaning services, periodic deep cleaning, floor care, window washing, washroom services, and general maintenance. The company operates with local branches providing services in clients' regions while benefiting from centralized procurement, training, quality systems, and management. OEM International employs thousands of service workers who are trained, equipped, and managed to deliver consistent quality. The company has implemented technology including digital management systems, quality control apps, and customer portals. The facility services market is characterized by fragmentation, low margins, high labor intensity, and operational complexity. OEM International has achieved scale advantages through consolidation, operational excellence programs, and technology investments. The company focuses on higher-value segments like technical services and IFM where margins are better than commodity cleaning. OEM International serves large corporate clients, property managers, healthcare facilities, and public sector organizations under long-term contracts (typically 3-5 years) providing stable recurring revenue. In 2025, EQT invested in OEM International recognizing opportunities for continued market consolidation and margin improvement through operational excellence.

companies.detailed_description: SPT Labtech is a leading provider of innovative laboratory automation solutions for life sciences research, drug discovery, and diagnostics. Founded in 1998 as a spinout from Cambridge University, SPT Labtech develops and manufactures automated liquid handling systems, sample storage solutions, and laboratory robotics that increase productivity and reproducibility in scientific research. The company's flagship products include mosquito® liquid handlers for precise dispensing in nanoliter to microliter volumes, dragonfly® discovery for reagent dispensing and plate replication, and comPOUND® systems for compound management. SPT Labtech's equipment is used in pharmaceutical companies, biotech firms, academic research institutions, and diagnostic laboratories worldwide for applications including high-throughput screening, genomics, proteomics, and assay development. The company's automation solutions enable scientists to perform experiments faster, more accurately, and with less manual labor, accelerating drug discovery and research timelines. SPT Labtech combines hardware engineering, software development, and life sciences expertise to create user-friendly instruments that integrate into laboratory workflows. The company has a global customer base including all major pharmaceutical companies and thousands of research labs. SPT Labtech generates recurring revenue from instrument sales, consumables, service contracts, and software subscriptions. The company continues to innovate with new products addressing evolving lab automation needs. In 2022, EQT Life Sciences invested in SPT Labtech recognizing the company's technology leadership and strong position in the growing laboratory automation market driven by increasing R&D spending and demand for efficiency.

companies.detailed_description: United Talent Agency (UTA) is one of the world's premier talent and literary agencies, representing actors, directors, writers, musicians, athletes, and other entertainment and media personalities. Founded in 1991, UTA has grown to become a powerhouse in entertainment representation, competing with CAA, WME, and ICM Partners. The company represents A-list talent across film, television, music, sports, digital media, and books, negotiating contracts, developing projects, and managing careers for some of the biggest names in entertainment. UTA's business model revolves around commissions (typically 10%) on deals negotiated for clients including acting roles, directing assignments, book deals, endorsements, and other opportunities. Beyond traditional representation, UTA has expanded into content production, brand partnerships, marketing services, and venture investments in entertainment technology companies. UTA Ventures invests in startups at the intersection of technology and entertainment. The agency has adapted to the evolving media landscape including streaming platforms, digital content, social media influencers, and new distribution models. UTA represents major talent including actors, filmmakers, musicians, and thought leaders who generate billions in economic activity. The company operates globally with offices in major entertainment capitals. In 2022, EQT invested in UTA recognizing the company's premier brand, valuable client relationships, and opportunities to expand services and leverage talent relationships into new business lines including content production and technology ventures.

companies.detailed_description: Endgame is an esports and gaming infrastructure company building technology platforms and services for the rapidly growing gaming and esports industry. The company provides tools, software, and services that enable game publishers, tournament organizers, esports teams, and gaming communities to operate more effectively. Endgame's solutions address critical needs in the gaming ecosystem including tournament management platforms, player ranking and matchmaking systems, anti-cheat technology, streaming infrastructure, and community engagement tools. The gaming industry has evolved from casual entertainment to a massive ecosystem encompassing professional esports, streaming, content creation, and social communities with billions in revenue. Endgame is positioned at the infrastructure layer, providing B2B services to companies operating in gaming. The company serves game publishers who need tournament systems for competitive games, esports organizations running leagues and events, and platforms requiring player verification and anti-cheat capabilities. Endgame combines gaming industry expertise with modern technology to address pain points in areas like tournament automation, fair play enforcement, player progression tracking, and spectator experiences. The company has partnerships with major gaming companies and esports organizations. As gaming continues to grow with younger demographics and new markets, demand for professional infrastructure and services increases. In 2022, EQT Ventures invested in Endgame recognizing the massive gaming/esports market and the company's potential to provide critical B2B infrastructure.

companies.detailed_description: Ducky is a climate technology company providing digital platforms and behavioral change solutions that help organizations and individuals measure, understand, and reduce their carbon footprints. Founded in Norway, Ducky creates engaging apps, games, and tools that make climate action accessible and motivating. The company's B2B platform helps employers run employee engagement programs around sustainability, providing carbon calculators, challenges, educational content, and gamification elements that drive behavioral change. Ducky's solutions enable companies to measure Scope 3 emissions from employee activities, engage staff in sustainability initiatives, and drive real carbon reduction through behavior change. The platform has been used by corporations, municipalities, and organizations to educate thousands of users about climate impact and sustainable choices. Ducky combines climate science, behavioral psychology, and gamification to create experiences that motivate lasting change rather than just awareness. The company tracks actual behavioral changes and resulting emissions reductions, providing measurable ROI for corporate sustainability programs. As companies face increasing pressure to reduce emissions and engage employees in ESG goals, Ducky provides a proven solution for the challenging 'people' aspect of climate strategies. In 2022, EQT Ventures invested in Ducky recognizing the company's unique approach to climate behavioral change and the growing market for employee sustainability engagement platforms.

companies.detailed_description: Charly is a workplace equality and diversity analytics platform that helps organizations measure, understand, and improve diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in their workplaces. The company provides software that collects employee demographic and experience data, analyzes it for patterns of inequality or bias, and provides actionable insights for HR leaders and executives to drive meaningful DEI improvements. Charly's platform addresses the growing importance of workplace diversity and the challenge organizations face in measuring and improving it objectively. The software enables anonymous employee surveys, demographic analytics, pay equity analysis, promotion pattern analysis, and sentiment tracking around inclusion. Charly's AI-powered analytics identify disparities in compensation, advancement opportunities, or experiences across different demographic groups, helping organizations address systemic inequities. The platform provides benchmarking against industry standards and tracks progress over time. Charly serves companies committed to building more inclusive workplaces, particularly in competitive talent markets where diversity and inclusion are important for employer branding and retention. The company's approach combines data privacy protections with meaningful analytics, ensuring employees feel safe sharing demographic information while organizations gain actionable insights. Charly competes in the HR tech and people analytics market, specifically focused on the DEI vertical. In 2022, EQT Ventures invested in Charly recognizing the strategic importance of DEI for modern organizations and the need for data-driven approaches to creating equitable workplaces.

companies.detailed_description: Cemvision is a climate tech company developing solutions to reduce carbon emissions in cement and concrete production, one of the most carbon-intensive industrial processes globally. Cement production accounts for approximately 8% of global CO2 emissions, making it a critical industry for climate action. Cemvision provides technology, software, and services that enable cement producers and concrete manufacturers to reduce their carbon footprint while maintaining product quality and performance. The company's solutions may include alternative materials, production process optimization, carbon capture integration, or low-carbon cement formulations. Cemvision works with cement companies, construction materials suppliers, and infrastructure developers to deploy lower-carbon solutions at scale. The company addresses a massive challenge: the world needs cement for buildings and infrastructure, but traditional Portland cement production is extremely carbon-intensive due to the chemical process of heating limestone. Cemvision is part of a wave of climate tech companies tackling hard-to-decarbonize industrial processes. Potential approaches include supplementary cementitious materials, alternative binders, mineralization technologies, or process modifications. The market opportunity is significant as construction companies, governments, and cement producers face increasing pressure to reduce embodied carbon in buildings and infrastructure. In 2022, EQT Ventures invested in Cemvision recognizing the massive climate impact potential of decarbonizing cement and the company's technical approach to this critical industrial challenge.

companies.detailed_description: Vara is a health technology company developing AI-powered tools for early breast cancer detection and screening to improve patient outcomes and reduce healthcare costs. Founded in Berlin, Vara provides artificial intelligence software that analyzes mammography images to detect potential cancerous lesions, assisting radiologists in breast cancer screening programs. The company's deep learning algorithms are trained on millions of mammogram images to identify suspicious patterns that may indicate early-stage breast cancer, sometimes finding cancers that human radiologists might miss. Vara's AI acts as a 'second reader' providing an independent analysis that can flag cases for additional review or provide confidence in normal findings. The technology addresses critical challenges in breast cancer screening: radiologist shortages, reader fatigue, inter-reader variability, and the difficulty of detecting small early-stage cancers. Vara's solution integrates into existing radiology workflows and PACS (Picture Archiving and Communication Systems), providing decision support without disrupting established processes. The company has achieved regulatory approvals including CE marking in Europe and works with screening programs, hospitals, and imaging centers. Breast cancer screening represents a massive global market with hundreds of millions of mammograms performed annually. Early detection dramatically improves survival rates, making AI tools that improve detection accuracy highly valuable. Vara is part of the growing medical AI sector where machine learning is augmenting physician capabilities. In 2022, EQT Ventures invested in Vara recognizing the company's potential to save lives through improved cancer detection and the large commercial opportunity in medical imaging AI.

companies.detailed_description: Videm is a Swedish healthtech company providing digital health solutions and remote monitoring technologies for healthcare providers and patients. The company develops platforms and services that enable virtual care delivery, remote patient monitoring, digital therapeutics, and connected health programs. Videm's solutions help healthcare systems extend care beyond hospital and clinic walls, improving access, patient outcomes, and operational efficiency. The company's offerings may include remote monitoring devices, patient engagement apps, telehealth platforms, or chronic disease management programs. Videm serves healthcare providers including hospitals, primary care practices, and specialized care providers looking to implement digital health programs. The company addresses trends including aging populations, chronic disease prevalence, healthcare labor shortages, and patient demand for convenient care access. Remote monitoring enables early intervention, reduces hospitalizations, and improves medication adherence and lifestyle management for chronic conditions. Videm operates in the Nordic market where healthcare systems are advanced and receptive to digital health innovations, with strong government support for telehealth and remote care. The company may partner with medical device manufacturers, health systems, or payers to deploy and operate remote monitoring programs. In 2022, EQT Ventures invested in Videm recognizing the structural shift toward digital health accelerated by COVID-19 and the company's potential to improve healthcare delivery through technology.
